Maybe more on the intended topic "have you had actual contact from God/religious experience" or so I assume from the Poll (voted no).
 
 Thought I did once some time ago at midnight mass, but came to realise that it wasn't but merely the feeling of belonging to a large group after feeling it elsewhere (at less spiritual or good times) and left religion behind afterword. Tastyfish

Yet God is infinite

 As mentioned it was times when it would not be good to feel God (playground fights kind of thing and other times when it is more mob mentality, and you suddenly catch yourself thinking things that you would never normally do.
 

 Did the priest teach that? 
 

 No, just me. Once you have realised (what I think) is the truth and seen the flaws in your original thinking, forgetting all those and accepting what you have disproved to yourself is near impossible. Anyway, I have no desire to go back, while sometimes you feel bleakness and utter despair, this never lasts long and soon gives way to calm, the rest of the time it lets you cope much better with many things with blissful acceptance. Feelings shared by quite a few Atheists who I have talked to in 'real life' or on the web.
Trancelation

You sure do like your poems, eh, Rapture? Well, here's one I wrote myself:
 
 The Question
 
 Haloes are holes
 that are made for penetration
 desecration,
 and souls
 are a figment
 of your weak imagination.
 Faith
 is an excuse
 a cover for your
 lack of courage
 that you could use to find,
 to discover
 an escape,
 a door from your
 enslaved mind.
 
 I will never say thank you
 because I
 cannot bring myself to have the attitude
 that I
 am something less than nothing,
 created from a need for sacrifice.
 
 If we are all equal
 then why
 is the space beside your visage
 reserved by
 those who make their
 chains unto your eyes,
 their battered skin
 and broken hopes
 sheltered from the storm of reason
 only by your unfulfilled promises?
 
 It's not that I don't believe in you
 but I
 do not think that you are worthy of the things they do
 to honor your life.
 No creator needs
 admiration, credit, or worship,
 the joy is in the ownership.
 But for you that isn't good enough.
 We are not allwed to stand up,
 only to choke on the veil,
 the image that has been pressed upon
 the shroud of blood cloaking our eyes.
 
 I will not bow,
 will not break,
 I will not supplicate
 to your wants,
 to your needs,
 I refuse to have faith.
 I will not bend,
 will not cry,
 I will continue to defy
 your demands,
 your desires,
 you are not worthy
 of my praise or my pride.
 
 Why
 do I feel
 the need
 to question,
 to breed an urge
 not to concede?
 If such love is possible,
 then why am I refused
 simply because I choose
 to refuse?
 The question just echoes,
 unanswered,
 into the ends of time . . .
